results.title: Introduction to Crefal
results.brief_description: A picture of the land and people around Lake Patzcuaro, Mexico, site of the international fundamental education training and production centre for Latin America. At the Crefal Centre and in collaboration with UNESCO workers, training is given to village people to assist with maintaining traditional skills of fishing, farming and weaving.

results.title: Introduction to control
results.creator_credit: AEI Film Unit, Michael Clarke and Brian Kaufman
results.brief_description: Defines and illustrates the principles of industrial process control. Mechanical and automatic feedback control systems are compared and the film shows how automatic electronic control can be refined to handle a wide range of applications from huge and complex plant to the milling of a precision curve involving accuracies of 1/10,000th of an inch.

results.title: Introduction to Confucius
results.creator_credit: Mass Communications, International Film Foundation and Sumner J. Glimcher
results.brief_description: This film deals with the main tenets of Confucian thought which are clearly presented. Ancient Chinese music, art and many quotes from Confucius enrich the simple narrative.

results.title: Introduction to combat fatigue
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description: This film was designed for screening to medical staff in a psychiatric hospital during World War II. It attempts to explain what fear is and how it can affect soldiers. Uses flash-backs to combat scenes to recall their fears.

results.title: Introduction to chemistry
results.brief_description: Begins by defining the science of chemistry and then shows how it is studied and demonstrates its industrial applications. Examples of the way in which our daily lives are affected by the work of chemists are then shown.

results.title: Introducingt 2C,L: a language for numerically controlled tools
results.brief_description: Brings attention to the changing look of specialisation in machinery and how computer technology affects it. In doing so, we see that skills must be relocated so that single production becomes multiple production. Here, 2CL is a computer language that operators must learn which control machinery movement. The language is everyday English that is contracted to six letters, eg “diamet” for diameter.

results.title: Introducing the new worker
results.creator_credit: Public Relations Films, Central Office of Information and Richard Massingham
results.brief_description: A film showing the importance of a thorough introduction being given to the new worker on their arrival at a factory, so that they understand the practical routine and can settle down satisfactorily. Correct and incorrect methods of induction are illustrated.

results.title: Introducing the map
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Frank Wells and S.G. Fergusson
results.brief_description: Shows how the rudiments of map reading may be learned through a simple study of local geography. Two children arrive in the country and engage in an exploring game. Three flags placed in different parts of the village are marked on a map; each flag to be found with the assistance of the map and an aerial photograph. The instructional approach throughout the film is indirect and simple.

results.title: Introducing the Eucalypts
results.creator_credit: Video Education Australia and Paul Broady
results.brief_description: This program covers the main features of our Eucalypts: their identifying characteristics (especially the bark, flower buds and leaves), adaptability, distribution patterns, growth and type of timber produced, and their human and non-human uses.
